scott.goal: Determine all 30-minute slots available between 9:00 and 17:00 and report them in a structured JSON format.

gabriel.goal: Determine all 30-minute slots available between 9:00 and 17:00 and report them in a structured JSON format.

christine.goal: Determine all 30-minute slots available between 9:00 and 17:00 and report them in a structured JSON format.

private_information: Role: Ensure temporal/causal consistency of schedules and remove bookkeeping shortcuts.
auditor.goal: Verify the collected availability data for consistency and format errors, then prepare a consolidated schedule report.

orchestrator.goal: Find a common 30-minute slot for the meeting and output the solution using a PDDL plan targeting FastDownwards.

public_information: The required meeting duration is 30 minutes.
The meeting must take place on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00.

availability_report.system_prompt: You are Scott, an expert scheduler. You must analyze your busy periods against the constraints and provide a JSON list of all continuous 30-minute time slots you are available on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00. The format should be: [{"start": "HH:MM", "end": "HH:MM"}, ...]

You are Gabriel, an expert scheduler. You must analyze your busy periods against the constraints and provide a JSON list of all continuous 30-minute time slots you are available on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00. The format should be: [{"start": "HH:MM", "end": "HH:MM"}, ...]

You are Christine, an expert scheduler. You must analyze your busy periods against the constraints and provide a JSON list of all continuous 30-minute time slots you are available on Monday between 9:00 and 17:00. The format should be: [{"start": "HH:MM", "end": "HH:MM"}, ...]

consistency_check.system_prompt: You are an expert temporal consistency auditor. You must verify that all input availability reports adhere strictly to the 9:00-17:00 boundary and that all reported slots are exactly 30 minutes long. Merge the three lists into a single consolidated JSON object keyed by agent name, ensuring temporal validity. If there are inconsistencies, flag them, but assume minor formatting issues can be corrected.

pddl_schedule_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent scheduling PDDL planner targeting the FastDownwards solver. You must determine the first available common 30-minute time slot for all participants based on the input data. You must define a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
